comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
A brand new AT-6F in USAF livery waits in the wide open spaces outside Dallas, Texas for her delivery flight.  A strange situation developed in June 1945, when NAA was instructed to stop shipping to the USAF and switch deliveries to the Navy. The Navy aircraft were known as SNJ-6 and wore different markings, which made for a flurry of repainting on the aircraft that were already well down the line.

Doug MacPhail
